abstract: State and local authorities in Michigan, facing concerns about lead in city of Flint's water supply, announce plans to test water in schools and homes and to provide free filters to residents.
lead_paragraph: Facing mounting concerns about lead exposure, state and local authorities on Friday announced a plan to test all drinking water in Flint’s public school system, provide free water filters to residents and expand examinations of the water supply to homes.

headline.print_headline: Michigan: Steps Taken to Test for Lead in Flint’s Water After Change in Source
